ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ ٱقْتَرَبَ لِلنَّاسِ حِسَابُهُمْ وَهُمْ فِى غَفْلَةٍ مُّعْرِضُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Mankind's Reckoning has drawn very close to them, yet they heedlessly turn away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: NEAR HAS COME the reckoning for men, but they turn away in remissness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The time of people's reckoning has drawn near, and yet they turn aside in heedlessness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The people's day of reckoning is drawing closer, yet they are heedlessly neglectful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The people’s reckoning is near, whereas they are in neglect, turned away!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Draws near for mankind their reckoning, while they turn away in heedlessness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Their reckoning has drawn near to men, and in heedlessness are they turning aside.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Nigh unto men has drawn their reckoning, while they in heedlessness are yet turning away;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Their reckoning draweth nigh for mankind, while they turn away in heedlessness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The time of reckoning has drawn near for mankind, yet they are heedless and turn away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: There hath approached unto mankind their reckoning, while they in neglect are turning away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Mankind’s reckoning has drawn near to them, yet they are disregardful in [their] obliviousness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Closer and closer to mankind comes their Reckoning: yet they heed not and they turn away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Draws near for mankind their reckoning, while they turn away in heedlessness.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The Reckoning for mankind is drawing near, yet they are heedless and turn away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Mankind’s reckoning has drawn near, but they turn away heedlessly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [The time of] their account has approached for the people, while they are in heedlessness turning away.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:1] Nigh has drawn for mankind, the people of Mecca, the deniers of the Resurrection, their reckoning, [on] the Day of Resurrection, yet they are heedless, of it, disregardful, of the preparation [required] for it by way of [embracing] faith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas who said regarding the meaning of Allah, Exalted is He, saying: (Their reckoning draweth nigh for mankind): He says: the chastisement that the people of Mecca were promised in the Book has drawn near, (while they turn away in heedlessness) while they are oblivious to it; they have disbelieved in and discarded it.
